alert.note: Alert for Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee; Osceola (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 25 at 5:38AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Patchy Dense Developing from the Treasure Coast Inland to Lake Okeechobee and South Osceola... At 540 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed that areas of fog had developed across parts of Indian River, Saint Lucie, Okeechobee and southern Osceola Counties. Visibilities were occasionally dropping below one mile, and as low as one quarter to one half mile in some locations. The fog is expected to persist past sunrise, and burn off between 800 and 900 AM. If you will be out driving early this morning, especially on I-95 or the Florida Turnpike, prepare to encounter rapid visibility changes due to dense fog. When driving in dense fog, slow down, use your low beam headlights, and leave plenty of driving distance between your car and the one in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Indian River; Coastal Martin; Coastal St. Lucie; Inland Indian River; Inland Martin; Inland St. Lucie; Okeechobee; Osceola
